CatDescriptText: Mrs. Elizabeth Walker, 2536 Elba Street was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 11, 1958, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that permitting children to work after school hours is detrimental to their general welfare--Health, school, and recreational time, etc?" answer reads: "No, I don't think that it is harmful to them. It helped me and I came to Pittsburgh when there was nothing except dirt streets here.  I have great-grandchildren and that's what they and other children need- work."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Elizabeth Walker wearing straw hat and herringbone coat with fur collar, holding geometrically patterned handbag, standing on sidewalk next to row of bushes
